review.title: Generation, Implementation and Appraisal of an N-gram based Stemming Algorithm
review.abstract: A language independent Stemmer has always been looked for. Single N gram tokenization technique works well, however, it often generates stems that start with intermediate characters, rather than initial ones. We present a novel technique that takes the concept of N grams one step ahead and compare our method with an established algorithm in the field Porter's Stemmer. Porters Stemmer is language dependent, and performance of our proposed method is not inferior to it.

sections.text: The simple N-gram tokenization technique works well, but often generates stems that start with intermediate characters instead of initials. We present a novel technique that takes the concept of N-gram one step further and compares our method with an established algorithm in the field - Porters Stemmer. Porters Stemmer is language dependent, and the performance of our proposed method is no inferior to that of the others. Keywords: Information Retrieval, Stemming, Conflation, N gram, Stemmer
